name: Jungian Psychology and Tantric Buddhism
description: Carl Jung wrote extensively on the benefits of Buddhism to personal development and transformation.  Explores the contribution of Jungian pscyhology to an understanding of Tantric (or Vajrayana) Buddhism.  Through experiential exercises, students will investigate the role of archetypal psychology and identification as a mediator of spiritual change.
exclusions: NEW433H1 Advanced Special Topics: Psychology of Tantric Buddhism
